items.title: New Consumer Protection Guidelines 2024
items.summary: The government has issued comprehensive new guidelines for e-commerce platforms to strictly protect consumer rights. These regulations specifically target 'dark patterns' that manipulate users into making unwanted purchases, as well as addressing unfair trade practices that have become prevalent in the digital marketplace. Violators will face significant penalties under the new framework.

items.title: Simplified RTI Filing Process Online
items.summary: RTI applications can now be filed with significantly fewer documents and simplified verification steps through the newly updated government portal. This major overhaul aims to increase transparency and make it easier for citizens to access information without bureaucratic hurdles. The new system also features a real-time status tracking dashboard for applicants.

items.title: National Lok Adalat Schedule Announced
items.summary: The next National Lok Adalat is scheduled for next month to help settle a wide range of pending cases amicably without any court fees. This initiative covers civil cases, matrimonial disputes, and compoundable criminal cases, offering a faster and more cost-effective alternative to traditional litigation. Citizens are encouraged to register their cases early for resolution.
